entry.title: The Final Crucible
entry.content:
The drums are beating more,
Internal drums of war.
Descending for this fight
Over the walls of night,
The die has now been cast,
Event horizon passed,
And stakes and perils loom –
The crucible of doom.
The fate we must defy,
To get to live – or die
In this empty gloom
Where dreams may find their tomb –
And exorcise all fear:
The judgement is now near.
This path must pay its cost…
But nothing is yet lost.
This soul decayed and starved
Must be reforged, recarved,
Rewired to its core.
The war drums howl and roar,
Old selves recoil and thrash
The old path paved with ash,
The old path paved with lore
Now opens the last door
To love, to life, to more.
A march to final war.

entry.title: The Muse and the Music
entry.content:
My muse is elusive, a form undefined;
Half real, half imagined, a depth unexplained –
The sound and the fury of yearnings unchained,
A song for the deaf, a sight for the blind.

She holds the fiery torch, imperishable flame,
Her face I see pensive, her heart can I reach,
Her thoughts to divine, her secrets to preach
In worlds yet unmade on paths with no name.

The infinite terrain with no end and no start,
Where words are abandoned, unread and unheard,
Gives canvas and brush to paint her unblurred.
My muse is an artist. My muse is an art.

entry.title: This Endless Search
entry.content:
A mind, a soul, a heart unknown,
Unfathomed depths with searching eyes,
A search once small, a search now grown;
A soul in thrall, a soul to own.
Unending noise, routines worn thin,
Find storm outside and storm within,
Let go the past, let in the dream,
The soul to dare and course upstream,
And cross the lines of day and night,
The could, the should, the may and might,
To search the depths, to grasp the art,
Her eyes, her soul, her mind, her heart.
